publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7940 Shirley-Anne Somerville: MECOPP—That the Parliament congratulates Edinburgh’s Minority Ethnic Carers of Older People Project (MECOPP) on being awarded first prize at the 2011 European Local Authorities Competition on Good Practice on the Support for Migrant Elders’ Initiatives in Brussels, an accolade awarded to those organisations demonstrating "outstanding municipal initiatives for the improvement of the quality of life of migrant elders"; considers that MECOPP has done valuable work in providing a variety of services to black and minority ethnic carers and communities in the Edinburgh and Lothian’s region, including the provision of multilingual language support, mediation between clients and third parties and support in education and employment opportunities; considers MECOPP to be an exemplar in this field of support, and wishes it continued success in the future. Supported by: Malcolm Chisholm*, Rob Gibson*, Stuart McMillan*, Bill Kidd*, Nigel Don*, Sandra White*, Robin Harper*
S3M-7940 MECOPP (lodged on 14 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*
